page.title: 06GLASGOW ZOO
page.content: {GLASGOW Z00}is owned by the Zoological Society of Glasgow and managed by Mr. O'Grady.It sits in 170 acres of woodland.The animals range from rats to Indian elephants.The zoo's role is partly educational and partly conservational.Animals are bred as a precaution against extinction.Students can see and study animals at close quarters.The welfare of animals is paramount and their diet is monitored. The animals are in excellent condition.A vet visits three times a week.The lion, Ranger is a favourite,as are some industrious porcupines.A new enclosure is under construction for two tigers arriving in June.Surplus animals are sold to other zoos or exchanged.The zoo plans to introduce further interesting animals.
